title: In Honor of all who Served
text:
Cave City in Sharp County, Arkansas — The American South (West South Central)
In Honor of all who Served
Erected by Cave City Middle School History Club.
Topics. This memorial is listed in this topic list:
[Military](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=32).
Location. 35° 56.375′ N, 91° 32.859′ W. Marker is in Cave City, Arkansas, in Sharp County. Memorial is on S. Main Street near E. Spring Street, on the right when traveling north. The memorial is located in Cave City Veterans Park.
[Touch for map](map.asp?markers=242695,85504,59179,170472,170366,221079,226571,221078,221061). Marker is in this post office area: Cave City AR 72521, United States of America. Touch for directions.
Other nearby markers. At least 8 other markers are within 12 miles of this marker, measured as the crow flies.
[Pfeiffer Community](m.asp?m=85504)(approx. 8.4 miles away); [Sharp County Court House](m.asp?m=59179)(approx. 9.9 miles away); [The Sharp Family and the Civil War / The Civil War in Sharp County](m.asp?m=170472)(approx. 10 miles away); [Old Baptist Church](m.asp?m=170366)(approx. 10.7 miles away); [Three Governors](m.asp?m=221079)(approx. 10.9 miles away); [Independence County Poor Farm and Burial Ground](m.asp?m=226571)(approx. 11.2 miles away); [Walnut Grove](m.asp?m=221078)(approx. 11½ miles away); [Southwest Trail](m.asp?m=221061)(approx. 11½ miles away).
Credits.
[This page was last] [revised](ChangeHistory.asp?m=242695)on March 9, 2024. It was originally submitted on March 9, 2024, by Thomas Smith of Waterloo, Ill. This page has been viewed 4 times since then. Photos: 1, 2, 3. submitted on March 9, 2024, by Thomas Smith of Waterloo, Ill. • Andrew Ruppenstein was the editor who published this page.
